alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for payments for employees' time spent travelling
body:
$!Payments to employees for time spent travelling count as earnings.$!

As an employer, you will need to:

+ add the payment to your employee’s other earnings
+ deduct and pay tax and Class 1 National Insurance through payroll

You won’t need to report these payments to HMRC.

##Technical guidance

Get more detailed information on [tax for working rule agreements: daily travel allowances.](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/eim71306.htm "Tax for working rule agreements: daily travel allowances"){:rel="external"}

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue and Customs
overview: Tax and reporting rules for employers providing payments to employees for time spent travelling for work
title: Expenses and benefits: payments for time spent travelling
